title: Augmentin 625G Tab 1x6 (P)
details:
Augmentin is a prescribed medication and belongs to the class of antibiotic medicine. So, this medicine is available only if the doctor prescribes you. It is the combination of two active ingredients known as amoxicillin and clavulanic acid havin

precautions: Some Augmentin tablet precautions are described below. Make sure you are following them.Avoid the use of Augmentin tablets if you are suffering from any allergy disease or having any allergic problem from the ingredients used in the Augmentin tablets. Otherwise, it will cause skin rashes, allergic reactions, shortness of breathing, or difficulty in breathing.If you have any allergic problem with the cephalosporins, then try to avoid its use as in case of allergic to cephalosporin increases the chances of allergic reactions from the Augmentin tablets.If you have yellowing skin disease, then avoid its use.Do not take this medication if the tablets have changed their colour or showing signs of tampering. Also, do not take this medicine if the expiry date has been passed as it may not work or cause any dangerous side effects.After consultation with the doctor, take this medicine.Do not give Augmentin tablets to anyone else, as the doctor has prescribed you according to your medical condition. For someone else, it can cause medical issues.Follow some precautions before you start taking Augmentin.Inform your doctor if you are taking any other supplements or medications, for example, herbal supplements, foods, or any preservatives.Also, inform your doctor if you are suffering from glandular fever. If this medication is taken during glandular fever, then it may cause rashes on your skin.Avoid the use of this medication if you have a liver or kidney problem. Otherwise, they will not work properly as they should do.If you are suffering from the problem of less urine passing, then try to inform your doctor about this disease. Otherwise, it will raise further problems for the patient.Augmentin use in Pregnancy: If you are pregnant or have the intention to become pregnant, discuss the pros and cons of taking this medicine in that particular situation. Also, inform the doctor if you are breastfeeding a child to avoid the possible risks which Augmentin can cause.Maybe all of the Augmentin tablet precautions are not described above. So, consult the doctor if you find any signs of its side effects.
effects: Some of the Augmentin tablet's side effects or downsides are described below.Common DownsidesIf you have ages between 18 to 60 years, then the Augmentin tablet can cause the following common side effects.It can cause diarrhoea, loose stools, and nausea.It can also cause skin rashes if you are allergic to any of its ingredients.It may cause side effects of yeast infection known as vaginitis. It can also cause vomiting.Some people may not experience the above-described side effects. It is also possible that these side effects may disappear with time as the user body adjusts itself to the medicine. Therefore, usually, they do not need any medical help. But if any of them persist, then immediately consult to doctor.Serious DownsidesSome of the serious downsides of Augmentin tablets are mentioned below.The very first serious side effect is liver disease. However, this side effect is not common. But the use of Augmentin tablets for a long time can damage the liver. Therefore, it will not work properly. But this side effect disappears, as the use of this medication is stooped.If the treatment is not stopped, then it will cause severe damage and will require proper treatment. Thus, inform the doctor as soon as the symptoms of liver problems appear. Its symptoms may include pain in the stomach, fatigue, and yellowing of skin or eyes.The use of Augmentin and another antibiotic raise intestinal infection. Inform the doctor as you feel its symptoms. Its symptom includes severe diarrhoea, nausea, blood in stools, and cramping in the stomach.Severe allergic reactions occur in people taking Augmentin. These allergic reactions most probably occur in people having allergies to penicillin. If a severe allergic reaction occurs, then the use of Augmentin will be fatal. This product may contain inactive ingredients (such as preservatives like benzalkonium chloride), which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of cystic fibrosis, hearing problems (including deafness, decreased hearing), kidney problems, low blood minerals (including potassium, magnesium, calcium), myasthenia gravis, Parkinson's disease. Tobramycin may cause live bacterial vaccines (such as typhoid vaccine) to not work as well. Do not have any immunizations/vaccinations while using this medication unless your doctor tells you to. This drug passes into breast milk in very small amounts. However, many doctors consider breastfeeding safe while using this medication. Consult your doctor before breastfeeding. Other medications that may affect the kidneys or hearing may increase the risk of kidneydamage or hearing loss if taken with tobramycin. Some affected drugs include amikacin, amphotericin B, cidofovir, cisplatin, polymyxin B, cephalosporins such as cephaloridine, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) such as ibuprofen, among others.
